text: Richard Lennon Murray (1840 - 13 March 1887) was an Irish-born Australian politician. He was born in County Tipperary to denominational schoolteacher Henry Murray and his wife Mary Ann. In 1861 he married Catherine McEvoy. He migrated to Australia in 1869, becoming a surveyor. In 1880 he was elected to the New South Wales Legislative Assembly for Inverell, serving until his defeat in 1885. Murray died at Leichhardt in 1887. ==References== Category:1840 births Category:1887 deaths Category:Members of the New South Wales Legislative Assembly Category:19th-century Australian politicians Category:Irish emigrants to Australia (before 1923)
title: Richard Murray (Australian politician)
